Great torrent, LW.

Decent Video and decent Audio.

Also in an attempt to settle this screener/DVDRip controversy..

DVDRip is mainly a tag used to confirm that it's a rip of an *official release* rather than a R5 release.

Screeners, though technically DVDs they're not *official* releases.

Other than that, there's really not much difference other than the variance in quality but if the screener is good enough, it can pass for a copy of an official release.

Remember, everyone.

Screener = Not so official
DVDRip = Official

Conclusion = Different tags for different meanings, other than that, there's really no difference.

Thanks again for the torrent, LW. Keep up the good work.

People who think that so called R5 (which only means DVD of region 5 - Russia for example) has any difference from any other DVD apart from the audio language are ignorant idiots! Thank U 4 your attention.

@ amarmitra

Correction, I don't agree that it *is not* a DVDRip.

How ever, I do agree that it isn't an *official* DVDRip.

R5 is in fact a DVD copy, though not *official* despite being a DVD.

The *official* DVDs are the DVDs that are *officially* released in stores in countries such as the U.S. and the UK, so on, so forth.

Again, there really isn't much difference other than the variance in quality. Other than that, R5 IS a DVD how ever an unofficial DVD.

If anyone else is similar to me, then they will agree that "R5Rip" and "DVDRip" are only different due to the meaning of the titles.

R5Rip = Unofficial Rip.
DVDRip = Official Rip.

And once more, there's really not much difference other than the variance in quality and an alternative source for the sound. Other than that, technically an R5 is a DVD, just an unofficial DVD.

Whoever fails to understand what I typed is either looking for a pointless e-argument or looking to prove a point that is ultimately moot.

And also once more-- Thanks for the upload, LW.

This is a DVD rip in the loosest of terms. This is NOT a cam in the theater. This is the digital copy of the film as it was one cutting before release to box offices. Ending compared to the theatrical version...eh....it was good, but not better. The box office ending was more jumpy/scary. The ending in this version is creepy enough to enjoy.
